description: Working with a small software development team and senior instructor William Pfiel at Oregon State Universityâ€™s College of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science to produce an artificial life simulation. The simulation will allow researchers and general enthusiasts alike to view basic cellular microbiology as it mutates and evolves through generations, producing complex interactions and interesting developments.

Embark on a turn-based combat journey from your command prompt with MASM quest, coded in MASM for x86 architecture. The program is designed to exemplify knowledge in MASM through the complex utilization of registers, high-level math, and the display and management of ASCII sprites.

Worked in a small software engineering group focused on the Scrum development framework to produce a recipe app which allows users to dynamically import and export recipes as well as create shopping lists.

This website was created to showcase my portfolio and to demonstrate my skills in web development and graphic design. It is programmed by me using no templates or frameworks in HTML and CSS, with a little JavaScript for interactivity. The website is hosted on a Node.js server.

Created a lightweight smallshell program in C to demonstrate knowledge in system calls, signal handling, and file redirection in UNIX. The program is designed to mimic the functionality of a bash shell.

Developed a one-time pad encryption program in C to demonstrate knowledge in security and object-oriented programming. The program is designed to encrypt and decrypt messages using a one-time pad cipher.
